direction.raw_text: lbs. It was my first championship. It made me want
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . more. The group disperses. PK beckons the photographer to wait. He grabs Geel Piet and forces him to stand, much to the little man's protestations, for a photo of the two of them. As the picture is taken Geel Piet has the widest smile imaginable. 86   INT. PRISON YARD - NIGHT                              86 The guards, all in crisp uniforms, patrol nervously, truncheons at the ready. The towers bristle with guns as hundreds of black prisoners file into the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally the night of the concert arrived. The prison atmosphere, normally tense, was keening. Each prisoner entering the yard is searched. It was prison policy to keep tribal rivalries boiling. Divide and conquer. The policy of control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was to be the first time in the history of the South African prison system that the tribes were allowed to mingle. And if trouble came, it would be the last. All the prisoners are seated on the ground behind Doc, who is raised with the piano on a small stage. Guards surround the prisoners -- a solid, edgy border encasing a black center. The front of the yard is filled with seats on which sit the Kommandant, his wife, assorted prison brass, politicians, and a smattering of the local Afrikaan Hierarchy. PK is overseeing the seating of the prisoners when Doc comes up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen my page turner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He asks a prisoner in Zulu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen Geel Piet? The man shakes his head.     PK looks worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reassuring) He will come. The Kommandant, all medals and polished leather, mounts the stage, signaling a beginning to the festivities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is Bormann? I need Bormann to translate to the prisoners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Kommandant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a problem here, Kommandant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to address these filthy kaffirs but I don't have a translator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll translate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can speak Zulu, PK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.   Listen up. He addresses the prisoners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell them this concert is the gift to them from the professor who, even though he is in prison, is not a dirty criminal like them but a man of culture and learning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (subtitled) The Kommandant welcomes you and looks forward to the great singing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For such a man I am happy to do this. But one hair of trouble and it's finish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hopes each tribe will sing its best and bring honor to its people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One wrong move and you get marched back to your cells and don't come out for a month.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says tonight let us be one people under the African sky. The prisoners break into spontaneous applause.   Von Zyl looks at PK, unsuspecting, pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did a good job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professor? He turns the stage over to the professor and takes his seat. The professor sits at his stool, poised. PK, in front of the singers, watches him for a cue. Doc drops his head. PK points to a group of singers. MUSIC and VOICE blend spontaneously. "The Concerto for the Great Southland" begins. Doc plays magnificently with great style. PK focuses on leading the singers. Each section, each tribe singing its own songs with its own distinct cultural imprints on rhythm, pace and tone. 87   CLOSE UP ON PK                                              87 leading the singers in and out of the MUSIC. 88   FLASH TO TRUNCHEON                                          88 being raised and lowered on a familiar back. 89   BACK TO SCENE                                               89 PK is caught short by the flash.   He falters a bit, then regains his concentration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 90   FLASH TO TRUNCHEON                                         90 coming down on a familiar head -- Geel Peit's. 91   ANOTHER ANGLE                                              91 Instinctively the first four prisoners in each group, the leaders, stand and turn to face their people. They take up the lead. PK, distracted by his inner vision, runs off stage. Doc looks after him, worried, but keeps playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Startled, Bormann jumps out of the ring and runs off. PK scrambles into the ring and cradles the lifeless, blood- ied head in his lap, and begins to sob. PAN DOWN along Geel Piet's arm to his bloodied hand, holding the snapshot of him and PK. The Concerto grows LOUDER around PK until it enfolds him in its melodies. The voices of Africa, the music of Europe, reaching for a musical and spiritual crescendo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geel Piet died of massive internal hemorrhage, the result of Bormann's ramming a truncheon up into the little man's body until his entrails spilled out. When I reached him he was already dead. I sat there crying, stroking his head and crying with African
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . voices rising to heaven above, even as her blood soaked the ground below. The MUSIC SWELLS until the voices meld as one. CUT TO: 94   INT. EXAMINERS' ROOM                                       94 The four examiners all sit enthralled by the story. When PK looks up, a tear runs down his cheek. Lewis, who is visibly moved, clears his throat. Another man blows his nose with a handkerchief, covering his emotions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you very much. You will be notified as to the University's decision by mail. PK rises and goes to exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Point of curiousity. PK turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your headmaster told me your work is somewhat autobiographical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This Bormann, he was real?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was justice ever served?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Sergeant Bormann died of cancer... (pause) of the rectum. PK turns and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 95   EXT. SCHOOL                                                95 76. Solly Goldman sits behind the wheel of his old car. Two figures sneak out of the school and come running toward the car. 96    INT. CAR                                                     96 Solly starts the engine as PK and Morrie hop in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to make a stop first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night won't last forever, boychick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll only take a minute. Solly puts the car in gear and drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 97    INT. MARIA'S ROOM                                       97 Maria is sleeping when a hand goes over her mouth.     She awakes, startled, to PK, finger to lips. CUT TO: 98    EXT. BLACK TOWNSHIP                                          98 A police car patrols the edge of the vast, dark, ram- shackle township, its cruiser light scanning the openings to the dark rutted alleys. It passes and disappears down the road. A moment later an African steps out of the shadows and whistles a signal. CUT TO: 99    DOWN THE ROAD                                                99 in the shadows, Nguni hears the whistle. He looks at his watch and up the road, tense, as another set of head- lights appears. Nguni steps back into the shadows. CUT TO: 100   INT. CAR                                                     100 77. Solly strains to see out his dirty windshield with the headlights as his car bumps along the unpaved road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night I escaped from the Tsar's Army it was just like this. Six of us -- four Jews, two Ukranians. Dark as anything. No streets. In the day we hid in bushes. At night we went.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You deserted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whey they come take you   at thirteen years old and   tell you it's twenty-five years   in the Army, it's your duty to   desert. Nguni steps out right into the path of the headlights. Solly hits the brake hard, throwing everyone forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said the end of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes.    Sorry. I drive. He opens Solly's door with some urgency.       Nguni sees Maria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome, miss, welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Nguni turns into the township and is swallowed by the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 101   INT. CAR                                                     101 The car bounces along the rutted darkened streets of the township. The glow of smoldering cooking fires through open doorways offers minimal illumination to the squalid lives within. Maria peers out at a world she has never seen. As the car drives, women and children gather along the road peering in. Mothers point to PK, instructing their children. 78.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onoshobishobi Ingelosi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The people have come from everywhere to see you. Maria takes PK's hand, a little nervous.      PK smiles at her confidently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the men?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are to be witness. The muffled sounds of VOICES SINGING reaches them, grow- ing louder as they approach. Maria is tense. Nguni senses this. He turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No worry, miss. It is the sound of happiness. He stops the car at a door in a high wooden wall guarded by two big men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are here. Everyone gets out of the car and passes through the door which shuts behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 102   INT. DIMLY LIT CORRIDOR                                       102 Nguni leads everyone down the hallway. PK is dressed to fight, hands taped, robe thrown over his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see why we have to weigh in. They're going to fight anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is very important the people see everything is correct. They come to    an arch which leads into a big empty room. In the center    of the room stands a scale and a dozen Africans, all    dressed in worn but neatly pressed suits. Mandoma, the    other man who attended PK's fight at school, clad only in    boxing gear, waits on PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you, Gideon Mandoma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you, PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want you to know you fight a man. Onoshobishobi Ingelosi is just a name I was given at Barberton Prison. It means nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is not for you or me to say what it means. An old man, one of the dignitaries says something to Nguni.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. He motions for PK to step on the scale. PK does. The weight is duly noted. Mandoma then does the same. The twelve men are satisfied. They head for the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is time. He motions for the others to follow. PK goes to walk with Maria. Nguni pairs him with Mandoma. They exit the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The party walks towards a big double door behind which a single VOICE PREACHING can be vaguely heard. Nguni knocks on the door. 104   EXT. SOCCER FIELD                                      104 The doors open to an entire soccer field jammed with humanity. A boxing ring is raised in the center. The only lights in the area directly over it. With the twelve witnesses in the lead, the party makes its way through a path in the crowd. An OLD WOMAN with a fly switch, not unlike Inkosikazi's, speaks from the ring. As PK passes the whispers start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onoshobishobi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Woman in the ring begins to chant.   The crowd picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onoshobishopi Ingelosi. Shobi shobi Ingelosi. PK looks back at Maria who is a bit unnerved, as are Morrie and Solly. He looks across at Mandoma whose face is a mask looking straight ahead, betraying nothing. The two men climb into the ring and stand in their corners. The Old Woman shuffles over and peers into PK's face. She mutters something inaudible, then turns to the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onoshobishobi Ingelosi. The crowd picks up the chant. She waves and the crowd goes silent. Somewhere in the darkness a single voice begins to sing "Nkosi Sikelel I Afrika" -- the African national anthem. The crowd picks it up. PK looks down to the front row where Nguni sits courteously attending to Maria in a seat of honor among the twelve men in suits. The African national anthem finishes. The BELL RINGS three times. The Old Woman is led from the ring. An Indian Referee in all white enters the ring and waves the two fighters forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are listening to me please. When I am shouting break, you must break at once. When a knockdown is coming, it is for an eight count. No heads, no elbows. You fight clean or by golly I am giving you penalty points. Good luck, boys. PK and Mandoma touch gloves and go to their respective corners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see? Solly watches Mandoma dancing across the ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A very tough fight. The BELL RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch the left hook. Mandoma comes charging across the ring and begins to fire everything in his arsenal at PK, overwhelming him. PK cannot get away from him and takes a series of devastat- ing combinations which end in a left hook to PK's jaw. PK drops like lead. The Referee starts counting. PK shakes his head clear and rises at eight. The Referee checks his gloves. There is a cut under his right eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Continue. Again, Mandoma comes charging hard. PK defends himself as best he can, trying to counter. But Mandoma's offense won't allow it. He beats on PK until the round ends. PK sits down in his corner. Morrie works on his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, he hits like a truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going for the quick knockout. He can't keep it up. Soon the truck runs out of gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he catches me again like that I'll run out of gas -- permanently. The BELL SOUNDS. PK is hardly off his stool when Mandoma is on him, pummeling him. PK backpedals, bobs and weaves. Mandoma's punches come fast and furious, each one looking to end the fight. Mandoma gets PK against the ropes and bangs away. PK covers up. Mandoma punishes his arms and kidneys. PK swings back and es- capes. Mandoma pursues him. He catches PK with a body chop and then a chopping left. PK goes down again. The Referee starts to count. The crowd is completely silent. The BELL RINGS. PK returns to his corner, shaking his head, trying to clear it. He flops onto his stool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's had it. He's got no strength in his punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could've fooled me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look -- he's taking water. They all look. 105   THEIR POV                                                  105 of Mandoma, breathing heavily, sweating profusely, drinks deeply from his water flask. 106   BACK TO SCENE                                              106 SOLLY See. Where that water goes -- you go. Right to here. He pokes PK's belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You put your punches there, you win. You don't, you lose. The BELL RINGS. Mandoma comes charging out. PK goes on defense. He hits Mandoma hard to the head. Mandoma whips around and hits him hard. PK spins and hits the canvas. His vision blurs, doubles. The SOUND of a WATERFALL fills his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 107   PK                                                         107 struggling to climb the rocks in the pool below the waterfall. He is halfway across this time. CUT TO: 108   REFEREE                                                    108 REFEREE Three... four... five... FLASH TO: 109   PK                                                         109 struggles to mount the fifth rock. He clings to it, wet, exhausted, as the water pummels him. CUT TO: 83. 110   REFEREE                                                        110 REFEREE ... seven... eight... nine... PK rises.    The crowd goes wild.      The Referee holds up six fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many fingers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a fight behind on points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   Continue. Mandoma rushes in for the kill. PK feints and comes up under one of Mandoma's punches, burying a body shot into his gut. Mandoma grunts and backs up. PK pursues him. Mandoma tries to recover. He throws another big punch. PK ducks under it and puts two more hooks into Mandoma's stomach. Mandoma starts to back up for the first time in the fight. PK boxes, jabbing, feinting, pushing Man- doma around the ring, taking control. Mandoma, heading for exhaustion, throws another big punch in desperation. PK hits him with three punches in return. Mandoma swings again with a last desperate effort, and PK buries the Solly Goldman thirteen into every part of his body. PK steps back and with his last punch, puts Mandoma down. The crowd goes silent. The Referee counts Mandoma out. He raises PK's hand. Still, the crowd is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in the shit now.      Nice knowing you, Solly. He and Solly look around at       the somber black faces flick- ering in the shadows of the       ring light. PK looks  down at Mandoma in silence. Mandoma        rises unsteadily. He  stands in front of PK, staring into       his eyes, and then he raises PK's arm above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onoshobishobi Ingelosi. The crowd goes wild, chanting, singing over and over as PK and Mandoma stand in center ring, arms raised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 111   EXT. DEVILLIERS SCHOOL - PRE-DAWN                             111 PK stands with Maria by the tree they use to climb over the wall. In the b.g. Solly and Morrie wait in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Seniors Dance is two Saturdays from now. I would like it if you could escort me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria Marais with a rooinek at the Senior Dance? What will people think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll think what they think and I'll think what I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what is that? Maria touches his face.   Her eyes soften.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I love you. PK swallows hard.   They kiss and embrace.     PK caresses her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would be honored to be your escort. Maria beams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't doubt it for a minute. Solly HONKS the HORN. PK kisses Maria once more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you a boost. PK stirrups his hands. Maria boosts up to the first branch of the tree. She crests the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for tonight.    You were great. She smiles and drops down behind the wall.     PK runs back
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . toward the car. CUT TO: 112   EXT. PRINCE OF WALES SCHOOL - DAWN                               112 Solly's car pulls up opposite the gate. CUT TO: 113   INT. CAR                                                         113 Morrie is sleeping in the back seat.         Solly and PK are sitting in the front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you and your manager first came to me with that meshuganah idea to be welterweight champion of the world you did not have a big believer here. But I gotta tell you. Now you do. In London lives Benny Rosen, the greatest trainer in the world today. When you go to your Oxford I give you a letter to Rosen. Whatever I can't do for you, he can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Mr. G. Solly pokes Morrie awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I give the address of a very good bookmaker. Teach you also a thing or two. Now, go on back to being fancy-schmancy English gentlemen. I'm proud of both of you. PK and Morrie exit the car and run back to the school. 114   EXT. CAMPUS                                                      114 As PK and Morrie jog toward their dorm a VOICE stops them from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen. PK and Morrie stop cold.      They turn to St. John, up early
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . for his daily constitutional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're up early, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best time for walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best time for running too, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have to put in the roadwork, sir. You know, keep those legs strong. St. John eyes the bruise on PK's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   Quite a fresh bruise there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tripped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you should change your footwear. He looks down at their shoes. Both boys are wearing pro- per shoes; not at all what would be worn for roadwork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To something a little more appropriate for... (beat) roadwork. Busted, the boys squirm uncomfortably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. St. John fixes them with a look, and then walks off.     The boys bolt into the dorm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 115   INT. PK'S ROOM                                              115 PK and Morrie open the door and stop cold. Gideon Mandoma sits in a chair facing the door. He rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please excuse me for coming like a thief by the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You speak English? PK is surprised.   Mandoma nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a great fighter, Gideon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Second greatest in this room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you didn't come to talk about fighting. Mandoma shakes his head.   He waits for a moment, then begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you say to me, Onoshobishobi Ingelosi means nothing, you are right. And you are wrong. The legend gives the people hope for a good tomorrow. But hope alone will not make a good tomorrow for the people. You cannot write our letters, get us clothes, food, work. These things we must do ourselves, so we can be part of this country's good tomorrow. If we are not, the hope will disappear. The people will grow tired. The tired will grow angry and there will be no good tomorrow for anybody -- black or white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you asking from me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be part of something you must know what everyone else knows. We have our own knowledge. We need yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We get our knowledge in schools, Gideon. We're not born with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it must be the same with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have schools.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. And teachers who cannot do more than their own ABC's. We have a system made not to teach us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am only seventeen years old, Gideon. I cannot teach five million people how to speak English and do sums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You taught the singing to thousands at Barberton Prison. You were only twelve. Mandoma rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a great fighter, PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Second greatest in this room, Gideon. Mandoma exits through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 116   INT. ST. JOHN'S STUDY                                    116 PK stands in front of a pondering St. John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are asking me for a lot, young man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only asking you to put what you've taught us into practice, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are asking me to put the reputation of this school in jeopardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reputation of this school, sir, is based on its integrity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm aware of that. I'm also aware of what will happen if this ever gets out. We live in a country where the rules are being rewritten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we'd better be careful to keep a firm hand on our pens... (beat) ... sir. St. John regards PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. I will allow it on a trial basis. Here are my conditions: you tell no one; you operate at night on Saturdays when the student body is gone; you involve no one besides yourself and Mr. Levy. If you can comply, you can have your school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 117   EXT. BEACH - LATE AFTERNOON                                 117 Maria and PK are about to race.    Maria is given a head start of ten yards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready.   Set.   Go! They both take off. Maria runs     as hard as she can. PK catches up to her. She strains     with the effort. PK crosses the finish line first.     Maria trips and falls, rolling in the sand. PK comes     back to her. He kneels down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're supposed to let me win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you'd say I was being condescending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were guilty of that when you gave me a head start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She kisses him and stands up.     They begin to walk along the beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your formal yet? PK grows uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dance is only a week away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria... (beat) I can't come to the dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shocked) Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have an obligation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you change it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a permanent obligation. Every Saturday night... (beat) It starts tonight. Maria cannot believe what she is hearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're breaking up with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what could be so important that it takes all your Saturday nights?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really can't say. Maria starts to cry.   She throws her arm around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: P.K., I love you.     Please don't go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you are.   I can feel it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not.   I'm just tutoring. Maria pulls back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I started a school... (beat) ... for Gideon Mandoma and some others in the seniors library. Maria's sadness turns to anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm losing you to a bunch of kaffirs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not losing anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No? Are you escorting me to the dance? Are you going to see me on the only free night they give us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria, this is important to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And my life's important to me. Damn you. She runs off in tears.   A pained PK doesn't attempt to go after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 118   EXT. CLIFF FACE                                            118 On an escarpment high above the dense green rainforest cover, PK and Doc move along the sheer cliff face with photographic equipment and rucksacks. PK notices Doc's labored breathing and slow movements. They reach some small cacti growing out of the side of 92. the cliff in full bloom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (breathing hard) Ach.   You see how beautiful?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever hear of glycerine, Doc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Going-To-Oxford-Smarty-Pants. Of course I know about glycerine. Triglycerine. Biglycerine. Monoglycerine. What do you want to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you don't use it. It's only a little pill under the tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tongues were not made to put little pills under. When I have to start with that, I become something else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, until you become something else, the little pills would make this easier on your heart. A CLAP of THUNDER cuts into their conversation.   Thick roiling rain clouds appear suddenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little pills or no little pills
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 92   INT. PRISON                                                92 PK runs through the empty cell blocks looking for some- one. PK runs through the corridors. He runs through the kitchens, the empty dining area, the SOUND of the concert chasing after him. He runs through the recreation area and past the boxing room when he hears a THUD, and another. 93   INT. BOXING ROOM                                           93 He bolts into the room and hits the light switch. The light over the ring comes on, illuminating Bormann, truncheon raised over the lifeless, broken body of Geel Piet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: we don't find cover, we both turn into something else. Lightning splits the sky.   Rain begins to fall, pelting the escarpment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look for a cave. Always in this kind of rock there is caves. Quick! Quick! PK starts to move horizontally across the cliff face like a spider on a wall. Doc follows. The rain becomes torrential. PK turns to look back at Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look at me.     Go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PK forges ahead. 119   HIS POV - OPENING                                         119 some 20 yards ahead. 120   BACK TO SCENE                                                   120 PK I've found something. The rain is so heavy PK can barely make out Doc behind him. When he can, he sees the old man pause, breathing hard. PK makes his way back to Doc. Halfway there, Doc waves him forward and starts to move. PK reaches the small opening and slips in. CUT TO: 121   INT. SMALL CAVE                                                 121 PK stoops in the small cave, dripping wet. A moment later Doc's foot appears at the entrance. PK helps him in. Doc slumps down, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? Breathing too   hard to reply, Doc shakes his head in the affirmative.    PK looks out at the rain forming a sheer wall of water   outside. He turns to Doc, who is getting up, flashlight   in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exploring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just rest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plenty time for resting when I am something else. Look. He strikes a match.    A wind from inside the cave blows it side to side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When does a cave have wind?    This
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . is more than some little cave, my friend. Doc crouches down and follows the beam of his flashlight to the rear of the cave where there is a small opening. He shines the light into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here.   See?   There is a passage. Before PK can say anything else, Doc has wriggled through the small opening. PK, a bit peeved, takes his own flashlight and follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 122   INT. SMALL TUNNEL                                        122 PK crawls after Doc, making his way through the small tunnel on his stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the pyramids are nothing more than man's attempt to recreate the first safe home our species had -- the cave. It is the ultimate safe resting place. The first place man could lay down and have a good night's sleep without worrying about waking up as something's supper. Doc stops crawling.   So does PK.   A DRIPPING can be heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear that? There is something waiting for us. Doc starts moving quicker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hope it's not hungry. Doc squeezes out of the small space. PK joins him in a slightly larger tunnel, the same size as the first one -- stoop height.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better, ja?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that smell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . All of a sudden there is a RUSTLING noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? Doc recognizes the sound. He pounces on PK, knocking him to the floor and covering him with his body. Not a moment too soon. For a thousand bats fill the tunnel flying through. 123   PK'S POV - BATS                                           123 flying wildly through the flashlight beams. In a blur, the bats are gone, disappeared into another tunnel entrance to the left. 124   BACK TO SCENE                                             124 Doc an PK rise slowly. The silence of the cave is punctuated by the DRIPPING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's stopped raining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who can think about rain when you are on the edge of the great unknown cave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bats didn't come from a shoebox, Mr. Know-It-All. Doc heads off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes I think maybe sending you off to that fancy-shmancy school was not such a good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was your idea. Your'e the one who pushed for me to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ja. But who knew they do such a good job of boxing up part of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . your brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which part is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one where is all the questions. The curiosity center. Look. Ahead in the tunnel is a luminous glow, filling an entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I tell you? Doc and PK hurry on. 125   THEIR POV - TUNNEL OPENING                                  125 As they come to a tunnel opening: a large cave, perhaps 200 feet wide by 100 feet high, filled with stalactites and stalagmites composed of pure, crystallized calcium carbonate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wunderbar. The whole chamber    glistens with an eerie phosphorescence. Toward one end of    the crystallized room eight stalagmites grown up from the    floor cement to form a huge crystal slab some ten feet    off the floor. A buttress of stalg- mites drip off it    forming a natural, if uneven, stairway. 126   BACK TO SCENE                                               126 Doc and PK stare at the crystal cave in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many hundreds of thousands of years to make this masterpiece? Everything outside can change, P.K. This remains the same. We are in the heart of Africa, P.K. The heart of Africa. Doc, in his own world of wonderment, wanders down into the cave among the stalactites. PK follows, soon losing sight of Doc behind the large crystal columns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, if a person stayed here for 100,000 years what would be
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . left? Crystal. Like a crystal mummy. Incredible, ja?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incredible. Doc's preoccupation with death irks him.   He studies a piece of crystal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish we had brought the camera. Think there's enough light to shoot? Doc does not answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc? His concern rises. He moves through the maze of crystal, his pace quickening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc? Still no answer. His vision obscured, PK reaches the elevated slab. He clambers up the buttress for a better view. When he reaches the top he stops cold. 127   HIS POV - DOC                                              127 lying on the crystal slab, eyes closed, hands folded on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not funny. Doc opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is incredible! The crystal. You can feel the life go right through you. Here. Doc rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come try it. 128   WIDER ANGLE                                                128
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   That's all right.   Can we go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have only just gotten here. What's the matter, P.K.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All day long you've been talking about becoming something else, about dying. You never talked about dying before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm 87 next month.   It's natural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to a sixteen-year-old it's not. It's painful. Doc realizes what PK is saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are right. I am sorry. Sixteen-year-old ears should only hear life. Doc starts to whistle "The Marriage of    Figaro" by Mozart. The RESONANCE of the WHISTLING off the    crystal sounds beautiful, exotic. Doc beckons PK to     join in with him. PK does so, hesitantly. Then pleased     with the sound and the feeling, more fully. Doc and PK exit through the stalactites, whistling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 129   INT. DOC'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                 129 PK and a very exhausted Doc enter. Doc sits down heavily on the bed while PK, shrugging off his rucksack, heads right for the small kitchen area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just set you up with some coffee here, so in the morning you won't have to bother making it. He begins to prepare the coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to tell you what
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . you can and can't talk about back in the cave today. I guess I just don't like to think of you being... (beat)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... becoming... (beat) ... something else. I know it's natural law and it's the way it is with everybody... (beat) I just wish it weren't with you. There is no reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc? PK turns to Doc, dead asleep, still sitting up. PK goes over and gently lays the old man down. He removes his boots and throws a blanket over him. PK blows out the kerosene lamp and goes to exit. He is about to hang their two rucksacks on two hooks by the door when Doc's voice turns him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here, Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crystal cave will be our secret, ja?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ja.  Good. I rest a little. (beat) The heart of Africa, P.K. Doc lays down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He is asleep when his head hits the pillow. PK watches Doc's chest, washed in moonlight, rise and fall lightly. A sudden sadness falls over him. The corners of his mouth turn up in a bittersweet smile. He finishes hanging the rucksack and exits. CUT TO: 130   EXT. PRINCE OF WALES BACK GATE - NIGHT                       130 PK and Morrie stick close in the shadows. PK looks at his watch and then twenty feet away to the locked gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ! If someone would have told me this is where I'd be on a Saturday night, last term of my senior year, I'd call them batty. (beat) You know, you're going to owe me for the rest of your life on this one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That all? I figured you'd hold me to it longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get the insider friend's rate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, mate. A black groundskeeper comes walking along, seemingly on his duties. PK pokes Morrie. 131   THEIR POV - GROUNDSKEEPER                                    131 walks up to the gate. He looks left and right, then quickly unlocks it. He walks away. 132   BACK TO SCENE                                                132 PK and Morrie advance.    PK opens the gate.   As he does,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Gideon Mandoma, followed by 15 men and 5 women, enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you, P.K.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you, Gideon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get inside before the whole bloody world sees us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morrie. He clasps Morrie's hand, first in a traditional hand- shake, then in an African handshake. Mandoma smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You some great friend. Morrie is taken by his sincerity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.    Stay to the fence. The group moves out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 133   INT. LIBRARY                                                 133 The Africans are seated around desks, waiting for Morrie and PK to tell them what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, class.     I know you don't understand a    word I'm saying, but part of    learning a language is hearing    it spoken. So -- I am P.K. He taps his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .K.  This... (taps Morrie) ... is Morrie. Now you all have a chalkboard. He holds up the chalkboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chalk and an eraser.      I will say
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . the letter. You will say the letter. I will write the letter. You will write the letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morrie will check the letter. All right? Here we go. 'A'... (in Zulu) ... say it. 'A.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .' The door to the library suddenly opens. Everyone freezes. Maria enters the room. PK is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. PK hurries over to Maria. Not a word needs to be spoken. Her presence says everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you might need some help. Or I can just sit and watch. PK hands her the chalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Class. This is Maria. She is now the teacher. (to Maria) We're doing alphabet, from the letter 'A.' PK takes up his position with Morrie, ready to check the chalkboards. Maria takes the front of the class. 134   HER POV - BLACK FACES                                      134 before her, watching intensely. 135   BACK TO SCENE                                              135 She battles the butterflies in her stomach as she writes an "A" on the blackboard. She clears her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .' No one says anything. Maria looks a little lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Repeat what she says. (to Maria) Say it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .' She writes it on the blackboard again.   PK and Morrie trade a look and a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .'     Write 'A.' She mimes to the chalkboards. All the Africans obey. PK looks up from checking the students. Maria's eyes are twinkling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 136   EXT. SCHOOL GATE                                           136 The Africans are exiting. Maria, Morrie and PK stand, receiving their heartfelt thanks one by one. Mandoma is the last to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are one brave Boer, Miss Maria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you are one lucky English. He kids PK.   PK blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night, Gideon. He playfully pushes Gideon out the gate and closes it. He turns to Maria and Morrie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I   think I'll go... um... lay on   my back and count the cracks   in the ceiling. 'Night. Nice to   see you, Maria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night, Morrie. Morrie runs off. PK takes Maria around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am one lucky English. They embrace and kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .K.     Can I ask you a favor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have to go in    or anything. You can hear the music    from outside. I'd love to     have one dance with you before    I graduate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel so good. Race you to the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need a headstart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She takes off.     PK follows. 137   SOMEONE ELSE'S POV                                        137 They disappear into the night. 138   ANGLE ON FIGURE                                           138 in the shadows, watching them run off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 139   INT. SCHOOL GYM                                           139 105. PK is working on a speed bag. Morrie comes running in with two open letters in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We made it!   We made it! He thrusts one of the letters at PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. I couldn't bear the suspense after I read mine.   I had to open it. PK looks at his letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three months and we're out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you talking about? He snatches PK's letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) 'Dear sir. It is our pleasure to inform you that you have been accepted to matriculate at Trinity College, Oxford,' etc., etc., etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says nothing about the scholarship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A technicality. Another BOY comes over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: St. John wants to see you two in his study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good news travels fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get showered and changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said to come as you are. Immediately. The Boy runs off, leaving PK and Morrie wondering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 140   INT. ST. JOHN'S STUDY                                       140 PK and Morrie enter to a somber St. John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanted to see us, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   Come in.     Close the door. As the door closes, BRIGADIER JOHANNES BRETYN, a quiet but formidable man, comes into their line of vision. Trouble is in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Brigadier Bretyn from the police department. Bretyn just nods his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has come to deliver, in person, an order to close the Saturday school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it is illegal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're only teaching them how to read and do sums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have certification to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prince of Wales is a certified school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   But not certified for that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . sort of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can he do this, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I can do it. Would I be here if I couldn't? Come now meneer headmaster. Let's end this now. I have a full day ahead of me still. St. John meets Bretyn's steely eyes.   He cannot hold the man's gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (resigned) The Saturday school is to be disbanded until further notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, meneer headmaster. Your cooperation in this matter is very appreciated. Good day. Bretyn goes to exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know it can't go on like this forever. St. John tenses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just doing my job. And if you'll take some advice, you should just do yours. Bretyn exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that really the end of it, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the moment I'm afraid it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we let them get away with it on our own grounds, it will never
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: change.   It'll just get worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: History disputes you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: History takes too long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes it does. But it is never kind to those who try to hurry it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel we should resist, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I, P.K. But this is not a subtle government. They mean to have their way and damn the consequences. And I cannot jeopardize this school, no matter how I personally feel. I'm sorry. (beat) I heard you were accepted at Oxford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.   Received notification today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, congratulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir. St. John looks at PK who remains silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To both of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tight) Thank you, sir. An uncomfortable silence lingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll talk before you go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.   Will that be all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'll be all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PK turns immediately and exits.     Morrie and St. John trade an uncomfortable look. CUT TO: 141   INT. HALLWAY                                                   141 PK walks down the hall, anger building in his face.       He exits the hall. CUT TO: 142   EXT. DEVILLIERS SCHOOL                                         142 PK comes up to the main gate.     A GUARD stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to see Maria Marais please. The Guard checks his list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. She's not allowed visitors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if I could just talk to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. PK backs away and moves off down the street.     He turns the corner. 143   HIS POV - TREE                                                 143 he uses to scale the wall is in the process of being cut down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 144   INT. PK'S ROOM - PRE-DAWN                                      144 Morrie is asleep.   PK wakes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morrie.   Morrie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to show you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time is it? He looks at his watch and turns over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I see it later?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   Come on. He pulls Morrie out of bed.     Morrie groggily starts pulling his clothes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, when we get to Oxford
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: separate rooms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you hurry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there some girl out there waiting for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Stunning. Breasts like casabas. Just waiting for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit. PK throws a jersey into his chest and pulls him out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 145   EXT. PRINCE OF WALES CAMPUS                                145 The campus is swaddled in early morning fog. PK and Morrie stand on the side of the school chapel while a black groundsman opens the door to the basement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're fooling yourself into thinking the bastards won't
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . come after us in here. The groundskeeper opens the door to the basement.       The boys enter. CUT TO: 146   INT. BASEMENT                                                 146 PK switches on a light switch to a cavernous space cluttered with old desks, blackboards and church pews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a church. Didn't you ever hear of the Christian concept of sanctuary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. But I'm not the one who has to respect it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even the Boer has limits, Morrie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure he does, but I'd still like to see a big bolt on the inside door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Levy? The Caretaker pulls a large deadbolt out of his pocket, with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 147   INT. SOLLY'S GYM                                              147 Mandoma and PK, both with protective equipment on, square off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now move it nice and easy, the both of you. Time. PK and Mandoma circle.   Mandoma throws a jab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They want us to close the school. PK counters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Mandoma lays in a combination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are still game. PK throws a combination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So are we.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you two find some other time to chat. This is a boxing ring, not a social club. Mandoma and PK start boxing in earnest, both smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 148   EXT. DEVILLIERS SCHOOL - NIGHT                                 148 A watchman makes his rounds. He passes by     Maria's window. When he is gone, PK appears from     behind a tree. He taps on the window. Maria comes to the     window and sees him. Her face lights up. She opens      the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was in the neighborhood. Maria puts her finger to her lips and waves him in.       PK climbs through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 149   INT. ROOM                                                      149 Maria points to the door. She puts a record on her phonograph. She turns to PK and embraces him fiercely, holding on tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're sending me away to school in Pretoria. I told my father I wouldn't go. He said if I didn't he'd see they arrest you and ruin your chances. I couldn't let him do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 150   ANGLE ON PK'S PAINED FACE                                       150 as he holds Maria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When do you go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next week. (beat) I want to make love to you, P.K. PK's eyes fill with her words.     She releases him.    They look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. PK leans forward and kisses her, awkward, as if for the first time. As their lips part, their breath shortens. Maria moves forward slowly, lifting PK's hand to her breast. He touches it. The heat builds. Passion overwhelms them. They begin to make love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 151   INT. ROOM - LATER                                         151 Maria sleeps peacefully in PK's arms on her small bed. PK lies awake, staring at the ceiling. He rises quietly so as not to wake her. He pulls on his clothes, gently brushes a wisp of hair away from her eyes, kisses her forehead, and exits through the window into the breaking dawn. CUT TO: 152   EXT. SCHOOL GROUNDS - NIGHT                                     152 PK and Morrie    stand by a side gate near the athletic field looking    alertly about. The gate  opens. The Africans led    by Mandoma come through.  PK and Morrie greet them.     When they are all through Morrie closes the gate and    runs after them. CUT TO: 153   EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD - STANDS                                    153 A man with a walkie-talkie sits in the shadows, watching 25 people run across the athletic field. He talks into his walkie-talkie. 114. CUT TO: 154   INT. CHAPEL BASEMENT                                        154 The light switch is  on. The four lights above the center of the room  illuminate a classroom area -- desks set up in neat rows  with stools, a blackboard. The other furniture has  been piled high against the walls on either side of the  room where the light does not reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'll all be seated we can begin. The Africans head toward their desks.    PK turns to Morrie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So far so good. Morrie's response is to throw the new deadbolt into its slot with a skeptical eye. PK takes his place at the head of the class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to thank you all for having the courage to come tonight. (in Zulu) Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will be teaching the first part of class tonight and Mr. Levy will teach the second. A woman whispers something to Mandoma.     Mandoma raises his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gideon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Marais.   Will she not be coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . This causes a flurry among the women. PK writes on the blackboard the word "see."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See. He says the word in Zulu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.    You see.     We see. He moves his hands, eliciting response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.    You see. We see. PK holds up a book with a picture of a boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see the boy. PK holds up another picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Girl.    I see the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see the girl. There is a KNOCK on the door.       Everyone freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .K., it's me. Morrie pulls the bolt, opening and shutting the door quickly. PK and Maria look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to say goodbye to my students... (beat) ... and to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The four women in the class speak in unison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the girl. Maria smiles, surprised. The moment is shortlived as a SOUND from behind the pews in the rear of the room turns everyone. In the shadows, risen from behind the piles of furniture against the two opposite walls, stand 20 policemen with long menacing riot sticks. Bretyn steps into the light. Mandoma gives a command and the Africans form a phalanx around the women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once warned.     Twice punished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're violating the sanctity of the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You are with your damned race mixing ideas, rooinek. 155   ANGLE ON MORRIE                                            155 by the door, slowly slipping the bolt lock, trying to remain innocuous while doing so. PK sees him and trades a look with Mandoma, who also sees what Morrie is doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least let the women go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want everything to be equal, little Boetie. Why not men and women too? Just then Morrie throws the bolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now! He goes to charge out the door, but to his chagrin the door does not open, locked from the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bretyn smiles cruelly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locks keep people out but they also keep them in. He has walked right up to Morrie, not taking his eyes off Morrie's for a moment. Morrie meets his gaze evenly. The moment is broken as Bretyn's baton slams into Morrie's stomach, dropping him to this knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get up, you bloody commie Jew! He bangs Morrie hard in the jaw, knocking him out cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain. The two police lines start to move towards each other, sandwiching the Africans, PK and Maria. Mandoma gives an order. The blacks pick up anything they can to face the inevitable--stools, chairs, a flagpole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.    Wait.   We'll leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late. You never should have come. At the ready. The two police lines tense to charge forward. The blacks brace to defend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!    Stop!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now. The police charge from both ends of the room, yelling, clubs held high. The Africans respond with their own war cry and engage the club-swinging police. A policeman swings at PK who ducks and buries a hook into the man's ribs followed by another to his jaw. The man goes down. 156   PK'S POV                                                  156
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Morrie has risen to take a policeman out with a stool over his head. Two other police beat Morrie from behind.   He goes down once again under their brutal clubs. 157   BACK TO SCENE                                             157 PK turns just as another club comes for his head. He slips past the blow and punches out his assailant with a lightning combination. As the man falls another cop charges from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! PK turns off-balance. Maria leaps. The club cuts through the air. Maria is caught flush on the forehead as she comes between PK and the club. She falls to the floor dead. PK swings a stool with all his might, breaking the cop's face open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria! PK drops to the fallen girl's side. He is frantic at the sight of her gaping bloody wound and the sight of her open blank eyes. The battle raging around him recedes before his pain and rising rage. All at once he explodes, screaming like a madman. He leaps at Bretyn and bangs one punch after another into the startled man. Bretyn's face is broken over and over against PK's fists. Still PK keeps pounding blow after blow into the fallen man. Three cops descend on PK and beat him mercilessly until he drops to the floor, unconscious. Mandoma is hit hard and goes down. The few Africans left fighting go down before the withering assault of clubs, fists, and boots. 158   EXT. CEMETERY - DAY                                       158 Maria's funeral. Hundreds of Afrikaaners are gathered. Daniel Marais and his wife stand by the open grave, grieving, as the minister reads the final prayers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The coffin is lowered. Daniel Marais steps forward and shovels the first dirt down after it. As Marais looks up he sees PK standing behind the mourners, 20 yards off. His anger replaces grief. Marais advances towards PK, clutching the shovel as a weapon. Several MEN restrain him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniel.    No. Marais glares at PK. All of a sudden a thousand African voices cut through the air, SINGING songs of mourning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thousands of Africans and a smattering of whites have gathered outside the cemetery. The singing rises from them. Gideon, Morrie, St. John and Solly stand in front of the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marais glares at PK, tears of rage in his eyes. PK stands his ground. Marais turns away, back to his daughter's grave. PK stands, tears streaming down his cheeks, as the SINGING ENGULFS the SCENE. 161   INT. PK'S ROOM - DAY                                      161 PK sits at his desk filling out application forms. Morrie enters.   He picks one up off the desk and looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're applying to South African universities?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case the scholarship doesn't come through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you so bloody stubborn? You don't belong in a South African university any more than I belong in the priesthood. Will you take my father's loan? PK takes the applications back just as a TELEGRAPH DELIVERY BOY comes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There a Mr. P.K. here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your scholarship. Morrie grabs the telegram.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sign here.   Odd name -- P.K.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waldo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not one to talk about names. Morrie scribbles his signature and proceeds to open the telegram. PK snatches it away from him. He pulls the telegram out. His face falls to worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc's missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 162   INT. DOC'S HOUSE                                         162 121. PK walks through the small house followed by Commandant Von Zyl. Nothing is out of place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since his pneumonia last year I've had one of the men drop by once a week to see if he needed anything. Of course you know the professor. He never did. PK looks out at the cactus garden, watered now by drip irrigation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the beginning of the week he wasn't home so I decided to drop by myself. Waited a whole day here. When he didn't come back I sent search parties. After three days I sent the telegram. Seven days is a long time for him to be gone. Do you have any ideas where he went? PK looks at the pegs where the rucksacks hang.    There is only one hanging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 163   EXT. JUNGLE FLOOR                                         163 PK hikes along, watching the trail. His eyes spot something. He kneels over the remains of a small campsite. PK touches the ashes. His eyes rise to the escarpment soaring above the jungle floor. CUT TO: 164   EXT. ESCARPMENT CLIFF FACE                                      164 PK climbs along the cliff face.   He drops down into the entrance to the crystal cave. CUT TO: 165   INT. CRYSTAL CAVE                                         165 PK stands at the bottom of the crystal slab almost dreading what he will find. He resolutely climbs the stalagmites to reach the top. PK's eye level shifts from below the slab to even with it, then to above it. As his sight rises Doc's corpse comes INTO VIEW -- 122. laid out, serene hands clasped on his chest. From above the stalactites drip onto his body ever so slowly, turning him, molecule by molecule, into crystal. PK stands off to one side. 166   HIS POV                                                    166 a small metal box by Doc's feet. 167   BACK TO SCENE                                              167 PK picks it up and opens it. Inside is a letter.    PK unfolds it, and with trembling hands reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Mr. Schmartypants. It did not take you so long to figure out what happened. I hope you forgive me for not saying goodbye, but I did not think it would be necessary between us. What could I say you don't already know. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That I love you with all my heart? That you have given me more in our ten years of friendship than three lifetimes could fill? That the last thoughts I have before becoming something else will be of music, cactus, and you? You know all this. PK turns the sheet to page two which is a whole side of music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night this music came into my head. It is my music for Africa. My music for you. So go. Be welterweight champion of the world. Be a writer. A great writer. Remember -- the only thing between a dream and a reality is you. Until we meet again, your friend, Doc. PK looks down at Doc as a PIANO CONCERTO, beautiful, haunting, BEGINS TO PLAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FADE TO: 168   INT. DOC'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                     168 PK plays the music Doc wrote with only the moonlight illuminating the page. The music is soul-stirring, rich, evocative. Tears run down PK's cheeks. PAN FROM PK THROUGH the CACTUS GARDEN to the FULL MOON illuminating the African veldt as the MUSIC dominates and then FADES into the night. CUT TO: 169   EXT. JOHANNESBURG TRAIN STATION - DAWN                             169 The overnight train pulls in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: disembarks. 170   HIS POV - STATION CLOCK                                            170 reads 6:30. PK exits the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 171   EXT. GOLDMAN'S GYM                                                 171 PK comes down the street. A police car sits in front of the gym. The two cops inside eye PK. He eyes them back and enters the building. CUT TO: 172   INT. GYM                                                           172 The gym is empty. PK enters and is stopped by the uncustomary silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?     Mr. G?     Anyone here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In here. PK heads for the office. He finds Solly packing up his mementos from the cluttered office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Goldman, why isn't anybody
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . training?    What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A repeat performance of history, my boy. Solly Goldman's being deported. Of course last time I didn't have the luxury of being able to pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what reason?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their reason is that I'm here illegal. I didn't enter the country with a passport. Like the Czar was issuing passports to Russian Jews in 1910.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is because of me, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, boychick. This is because of them. They are the problem, not you. Don't ever think different. You look tired. Want a glass tea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no.   I have to get back to school. Solly opens his arms.   PK hugs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got your head screwed on right. Don't let these meshuganahs screw it on wrong. Now go on. You want to find me, look at Benny Rosen's gym in East End, London.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not finished yet. PK smiles and exits. Solly waits for a moment, then goes back to packing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 173   EXT. PRINCE OF WALES SCHOOL - MORNING                     173 PK comes up to the school gates. He notices two plain- clothes police cars just across the road. PK enters with a growing sense of uneasiness. CUT TO: 174   INT. PK'S DORM                                            174 PK hurries down the hall to his room. He opens the door to Daniel Marais, sitting at his desk, reading from his fiction-filled notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a very good writer. The subject matter is a little inflammatory but the style is interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came to inform you that you will not be receiving aid from the National Scholarship Fund. Neither will you be admitted to any of the South African universities. Here are your applications back. He hands PK the applications as he rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you when you came to my house. I am first a member of my tribe and I will defend it any way I know how. He and PK glare at each other, implacable enemies. Marais exits. PK looks out his window, thinking. 175   HIS POV - MARAIS                                          175 walking off across the campus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't want you here any more than they want me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 176   BACK TO SCENE                                                176 PK turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the hint. Screw the scholarship. Come on. Let's leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I leave or if I stay in South Africa it's because I choose to, not because they choose for me. He takes a small handbag, throws a few books into it and Doc's picture. He picks up his notebook and packs that too. He goes to exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save my place at Oxford. PK exits the room. Morrie chases after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .K., goddammit! He grabs PK, stopping him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save my place. Morrie's grip releases. PK walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 177   EXT. COPPER MINE - DAY                                       177 Hundreds upon hundreds of black laborers and white mine workers descend into the mines. A milling mass of disenfranchised humanity come to work the underground hell of the copper mines. PK exits the management shack and walks through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Morrie.     Here is how it works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The copper of the mines in Northern Rhodesia is mined below ground. All day a behemoth of a man, a diamond driller, works a stope which is like the top of a funnel. CUT TO: 178   INT. STOPE                                              178 A huge diamond driller at work drilling and blasting in the stope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Setting charges and drilling the rock. The only way for the raw ore he takes from the sides of the stope to get to the haulage below is to pass through the spout of a funnel and out the steel doors at the bottom -- sixty feet down.
direction.name: direction
