direction.raw_text: : 179   TRAPPED DOORS AT BOTTOM OF FUNNEL                             179 opening, as the haulage cart fills with ore and moves away on the track in the tunnel below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halfway down the spout area is a set of six tungsten steel bars called a grizzly which catch all the rocks too large to make it through the funnel mouth to safe haulage. 180   ANGLE ON GRIZZLY                                              180 six bars with men working them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are taken care of by a grizzly, an explosives expert whose job it is to keep the ore flowing, and since when the ore doesn't flow, neither does the money, working the grizzly is a very crucial and therefore very well-paid position. Three months'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . work earns a year's    stay at Oxford. Yesterday,     on receiving my blasting license    from the School of Mines, I    signed on to work the bars for a    year. CUT TO: 181   INT. MINER'S BAR                                            181 A crude place where the bar runs the back length of the room and the bare concrete surroundings offer nothing in the way of diversion from the main purpose of being there -- to drink hard and long. THOMAS, a harsh, ruddy-faced Welshman, the School of Mines instructor, downs a drink, pours another and looks up at PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy?     To sign on for a year?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said I was the best you ever taught, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you are, boyo. The absolute best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But even the best doesn't survive a year on the bars. Down in that damn tube the luck runs out sooner than later. You may be a genius at reading the rock but you ain't no fuckin' fortune teller. Thomas throws back another drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You worked grizzly a year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And let me show you what I have to show for it to this day. He holds up his hand.   It shakes noticeably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's thirteen years after the fact, boyo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A NOISE from the doorway turns Thomas's attention. He looks over as four huge men enter, drillers, men whose faces and bodies are as hard and massive as the rock they work. One of the men pauses at the door and grabs his head as an enormous jolt of pain runs through it. He shakes it off and follows his friends to a table. Thomas looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unconvincing) Nothing. The BARTENDER comes over and puts another shot in front of Thomas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One double brandy. One... (derisive) lemon soda. He puts the lemon soda in front of PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, then. Thomas lifts his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On being the best damned blaster ever taught by Ian Thomas. Cheers. Thomas and PK clink glasses.     Thomas knocks his shot back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another. The bartender pours another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you don't want one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like the taste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taste?     You don't drink for the taste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He holds out his hand. It is steady now. He fixes PK with a portentous stare. Thomas looks over at the table of drillers. The man with the headache is downing one shot after another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell's comin'. He draws PK's attention to the drillers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drillers. He's got a powder pain from breathin' too much of that damn gelignite. The pain's bad enough. Mixed with a little alcohol it's fuckin' lethal. He watches the driller down two more shots of liquor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.   We ain't got much time. Thomas directs PK towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two most dangerous things you'll ever see in your life, boyo: a hangup of rock that won't blast free on first shot and a driller with a powder headache drinkin'. As they reach the door the behemoth explodes with a roar. He grabs his head and staggers backwards; a mad look comes into his eyes. His three huge frineds rush to grab him.   He throws them off as if they were ants. He rips a table out of its bolting to the concrete floor and flings it across the room. The men drinking in the bar, all tough cases, begin to flee. Thomas grabs PK whose eyes stare in amazement as the behemoth struggles against his three massive friends and pulls him out of the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 182   EXT. MINER'S CAMP - TWILIGHT                               182 Pk is watching a rugby match being played at twilight. The players are a rough, brutal bunch and play their 131. game accordingly.   Fights continually break out. Off a play a fight breaks out. One of the men is kicked unconscious. Two of his teammates carry him off the field, dumping his body unceremoniously like a sack of potatoes on the sidelines. They run back as play resumes. PK turns and walks back through the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A company-built miner's camp. Cement huts with steel doors and corrugated roofs. No shrubbery, only dust, cement, and the roughest-looking bunch of men assembled on earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Morrie. To answer your question: yes--sports are played here, but only in the loosest sense of the words "sport" and "play". The rules are different for everything, in games as well as in the rest of our lives. The managers, the foremen, the company people. They live apart from the miners. They have families. Proper gardens. Sunday dinners. The miners--the crud, as we are called
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: don't. This is a society of men, many of whom have pasts better left behind. Future does not apply. It is a society only in the loosest sense of the word. The laws of survival are simple-- you either do or you don't. PK comes down a side street. A half a dozen men at cards, hard-faced desperadoes, see him pass, eyeing him closely. PK averts his eyes. From behind his back comes the sound of LIPS PUCKERING loudly, indecently. PK swallows hard. The sound of a CHARGE turns him to the six men bolting from their card game after him, whooping with lascivious intent. PK takes off. The chase takes PK and his pursuers flying through the streets of the camp, past one identical cement hut after another.  People watch, disinterested. No one raises a hand to help. PK comes racing around the corner to three of the men
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . blocking the street in front of him. He whirls. The others catch up behind, yelling and hooting. The two lines advance. PK gets ready. When the first man is close enough he hits him hard, breaking his jaw. He swings at another, catching him flush in the face. But then the rest are upon him. Even though PK fights like hell, he is overwhelmed. The blows come from everywhere, beating him to the ground. His arms and legs are firmly grabbed by four men. He is banged hard face down onto a concrete table. The fifth man pulls down his pants and the sixth begins to undo his own fly. All the men scream obsceni- ties, anticipating the rape. PK struggles like hell to no avail. As he is about to be violated, a roaring giant of a man tears into the pack like a bear shredding dogs. He scatters the men, knocking some unconscious, sending the rest to flight. He stands over PK, a looming block of granite with a wild black beard and coal-black eyes. His intent only becomes clear as to whether he is claiming a prize or helping a friend when he offers PK his hand, lifting PK effortlessly. He examines PK's bruised face with some concern and then smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Rasputin, I had them right where I wanted them. Another minute they were done for. Rasputin claps PK on the back and addresses him in Russian, to which PK responds with a smile. The two men walk off together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 184   INT. PK'S HUT - NIGHT                                        184 A TCHAIKOVSKY SYMPHONY plays on a rickety   OLD RECORD PLAYER. PK works out on a speed bag and    a heavy bag he has hung in the room while Rasputin, the   giant Russian, sits next to the record player, finishes   drinking a bottle of brandy, tears running down his   face as he fol- lows the symphony. When he finishes the    bottle he takes another one out of a case sitting by his   side and begins to drink anew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friendships are rare--arising out of mutual need rather than
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . any shared interests. But they do exist and even flourish. Except between the drillers and their grizzlies. No one wants to get too close to the man who might be buried at night by what you drilled loose in the day. CUT TO: 185   EXT.   MINE - NIGHT                                          185 PK inspects his nightly quota of gelignite charges and fuses. Five Africans, all serious faces, keep their eyes firmly on PK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Africans who come here looking for work are driven by a different desperation--drought, famine, locusts. Satisfied with the equipment, PK nods for the box to be closed. ELIJAH, his head man, closes the boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come and risk their    lives to send money back home to    the families sitting on the    barren farms, starving, waiting    for death or rain. When the boxes are closed the other five men in the crew lift them and follow PK out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 186   INT. MINE ELEVATOR                                           186 The elevator descends into the mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Superstition runs deep in them, so a good grizzly man attracts a good crew. On the bars, the longer you live the luckier you are. And by association -- they are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CUT TO: 187   INT. TUNNEL                                               187 PK and his crew make their way through a narrow tunnel and come to the grizzly. It is dark. The only light comes from the lamps attached to their helmets. Boulders litter the bars. PK and Elijah are onto the bars first.   Their light beams move along across the boulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baas.   Baas. PK turns to Elijah. His lamp catches Elijah's face which is looking upward. PK looks up. His POV in the narrow bands of light: a bunch of rocks big and small, packed into the funnel. His face grows dim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 188   CLOSEUP ON HANGUP OF ROCKS                                188 Five feet across a rock wall with stones of all sizes blocking up the funnel's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hangups are the worst of it. When the top of the funnel gets blocked up and the ore won't flow. PK scales the sheer rock wall of the funnel, his shirt packed with explosives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only way to unblock it is to set a charge to blow inward. And the only way to do that is to set the charge in mud, which means climbing up to the mouth of the stope and coming face-to-face with the devil. PK reaches the hangup. He works at taking a prepared parcel of gelignite sticks and jamming them carefully into a crevice. As he does the hangup creaks deeply, shifting, ominous. A few rocks fall. PK freezes, holding his breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 135. 189   THE AFRICANS                                               189 peeking out of the safety shaft below, terrified. Elijah remains on the grizzly bars, his light shining on PK. CUT TO: 190   PK                                                         190 holding very still, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes the rock doesn't need the provocation of explosives. Sometimes the earth shifts... (beat) a pebble moves... (beat) you talk too loud... (beat) and in the moment before you are turned into something else by fifty tons of rock you understand why it is called grizzly. PK finishes setting the charge. He scales down the wall. A large rock is expelled from the hangup and comes bouncing down the sides to the funnel, just missing PK, crashing through the bars below. PK freezes. Elijah holds his breath.   The crew in the safty tunnel quakes. Nothing happens. PK comes down the rest of the way. He takes the cordtex rope dangling from the bomb and inserts a fuse. He nods to Elijah. Elijah lights a cheesa stick. He hands the glowing stick to PK. PK waves towards the tunnel. One of the Africans sounds the WARNING WHISTLE. Two blasts followed by two blasts. PK nods for Elijah to be off. Elijah stands his ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wait for you, baas. PK lights the fuse. Elijah takes off like a scared rabbit for the safety of the shaft. PK is right on his tail. The fuse travels quickly toward the bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Elijah trips. PK, coming behind him, grabs him by the collar and flings him into the safety tunnel, diving after him a second later, just as the BOMB EXPLODES. A few rocks come down, but nothing else. The Africans look at each other with real apprehension. PK rises from Elijah and peeks out. 191   HIS POV - HANGUP                                           191 is still in place. PK studies the hangup, stepping out onto the grizzly, listening, looking. The hangup groans. The Africans are petrified at the mouth of the tunnel. PK stops midway on the bars. He studies the hangup intently, then picks up a rock. Choosing a target he heaves the rock with all his might toward the hangup and runs like hell. The rock hits the hangup. PK springs off the grizzly, right into the Africans as the hangup thunders down. Dust and small rocks fill the safety tunnel. When the avalanche has stopped PK raises himself off the Africans. They are all covered in dust but smiling and babbling, happy to be alive. PK peeks out and up. He signals to Elijah who hits the LL-CLEAR WHISTLE. Three blasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's clean her off and call it a night, hey? Happy, the Africans lift shovels and crowbars to clear the bars. As they pass PK they touch him reverentially as one would an icon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Africans think the longer you survive the luckier you are. And the luckier you are the longer you survive. I know there's something inherently wrong with their logic. Still, I'm beginning to see their point. Especially with less than six months to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 192   INT. PK'S HUT - NIGHT                                   192 PK and Rasputin play a game of chess as TCHAIKOVSKY plays in the background. There is a KNOCK on the DOOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. JOCKO, the bookmaker, enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ay, man. If you'd let him win once in a while we could take a little book on it here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't care if he wins.     He just likes to play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like to win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which    is why I'm about visiting you.     You've come on the board, man.     There are odds on your making    it or not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not in your favor, my boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you telling me this, Jocko?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you come up on the boards, boyo, it's time to bow out. It's an omen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bow out you can't make book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it's not a bet I want to collect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, Jocko, how high will the odds go on something like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shorter your time, the higher they go. With you probably ten, twelve, thirteen to one when you're short a month.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the odds hit the top put me in against all bets for two hundred quid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did not come here to solicit your bet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. I appreciate it. But if you don't take it, someone else will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All  right. You're a bleery fool. And  I'll be prayin' every night it's  the only bet I ever have to pay  off on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so will I. Jocko rises to exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should let him win once in a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When he wins it won't be because I let him. Rasputin says something in Russian as he moves a piece, excited to have taken one of PK's pieces. PK turns and checkmates him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Checkmate. Rasputin laughs, speaks in Russian, and starts to set the board up again. Jocko exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CUT TO: 193   INT. MINE ELEVATOR                                         193 The elevator descends into the shaft. PK and his crew exit. There is a low sound of a blast, muffled, that stops them all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear a blast whistle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, baas. Then after a moment the vague sound of a drill leaps through the rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never heard a drill at night. The Africans get nervous.   They chatter to one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a ghost. It's just some driller trying to squeeze extra pay. Come on. PK moves forward. The Africans follow him out of the elevator with reluctance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 194   INT. END OF TUNNEL                                         194 PK steps out onto the bars with Elijah and examines the debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baas. There is a tremor of fear in his voice.   PK follows Elijah's face upwards to a hangup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not the first bloody thing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad sign, baas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad drilling's more like it. Come on. Let's get it going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Elijah goes back to fix the charge while PK studies the hangup. He hears the Africans talking in the dark. When his light points on them they stop, turning their heads away. Elijah comes back with the bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter with them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say juju. Bad magic is in the mine tonight. PK heeds the warning, somberly. He takes the bomb from Elijah and starts to climb the wall. TRACK with PK as he makes it up to the hangup. He quickly seals the bomb and drops the cordtex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the bars, catching the rope. He is growing more nervous by the moment as he fastens the fuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: making it down the side of the tunnel. The hangup shifts.   PK freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: peeking out of the safety tunnel, scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scared, but standing his ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's playing with us tonight. Fuse set? Elijah nods. PK holds his hand out for the cheesa stick. Elijah lights the flare. He goes to hand it to PK. PK notices Elijah's hands shaking. He sees the fear in Elijah's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stay with you, baas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's an order. Elijah, released from his responsibility, retreats quickly. PK stands holding the flare, a little distracted by Elijah's fear, wondering. Elijah sounds the BLAST WHISTLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One... two... three. A MUFFLED BLAST comes from the other side of the hangup deep in the stope. PK freezes, confused, and then a SECOND BLAST goes off. The hangups starts to give. And ANOTHER BLAST. PK lights his own fuse and runs like hell over the bars toward the tunnel. The hangup, loosened by the explosions inside, gives before PK's bomb ignites. The rock is crashing down. PK races the rock. The tunnel is within sight. The men yell for him to jump. PK is about to leap when a rock hits the bar, bounces up, and catches him in the stomach. He  loses his balance and goes over the side as the hangup comes crashing down. PK hits the wall of the lower funnel -- once, twice -- and then lands in the soft stuff -- the shale flake, cushioning the steel doors below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 200   HIS POV                                                    200 against the wall of rock. A rock ledge carelessly left when the funnel was originally built. PK rolls under it. A moment later fifty tons of ore in large chunks and small chunks and dust comes crashing down, burying PK. He lays there, semiconscious, buried but alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The falling rock has stopped. The   funnel is full. The bars as well. Elijah and the crew   look out of the safety tunnel tremulously. Elijah   looks up the stope. His light catches a man at the very  top of the stope climbing out. Elijah pulls the WARNING WHISTLE.   Five blasts over and over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men hear the WHISTLE and stop work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men shovelling ore stop shovelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rasputin is timbering with his crew, fitting huge timbers into place, making new haulage, when he hears the whistles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He yells at his crew to grab the tools and he runs off down the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 205   INT. PK'S GRIZZLY                                       205 A deep hole has been dug through    the rock piled in the lower funnel. Rock comes up in     a bucket and is carted off. Timber is passed down. A      crowd of miners, black and white, watch and help where    they can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead.   No doubt about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You give me a fair odds on ten quid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four to one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it a sixer and you got me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone else?   Six to one he's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 206   INT. HOLE                                                     206 Rasputin works like a man possessed, piling rocks in the bucket to be passed up, shoring timbers as they are passed down. CUT TO: 207   INT. BARS                                                     207 Elijah is pointing up the stope to two Mine Managers as dozens more mill around, hauling the rock out, trying to help. TWO MINERS observe Elijah and the managers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says someone was up there. Blasted it out on PK from the other side?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's the driller?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Botha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one drills Botha's stope but Botha, and he only works days. The miners look at each other knowingly and return to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rasputin, bloodied, his hands ripped apart by the stones, his chest torn by the rough timbers, labors on, Herculean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: buried.   He hears movement above, faint but perceptible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help.   Help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rasputin sends another bucket up. He stands, his chest heaving. He hears something. He drops his ear to the floor. He hears the FAINTEST SOUND.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He starts tearing away at the rock, doubling his effort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! PK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: almost unconscious, hearing Rasputin's voice.   He breaks into the smallest of smiles and passes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, look at ya now, boyo. Up and at 'em in no time. And rich as a fuckin' lord. He tosses a fat wad of cash on PK's bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your ticket to ride. Two hundred quid at fourteen to one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I didn't make it.   I'm a month short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not according to managment. They cashed you out at twelve months for eleven worked. Last thirty days was bonus. And until someone shows me a calendar reads different, twelve months and a year are one and the same kind of thing. And the bet was for a year. So get yourself mended and get your ass out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's someone I have to see first. Jocko grows uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to go pressin' it for? You're rich, lad. You're whole. Why do you want to go pressin' it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I want to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know what?   That the man has
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . blasted so much gelignite he's permanently deranged in the attic? That even the other drillers leave the bar when the man drinks, so crazed does he get. All right. He tried to kill you. But he didn't. You're alive is all that matters. Do us all a favor, boyo. Get out of here. Get on a train and don't come back. We've no liking to be burying someone we're all so fond of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No worries. The luckier you are, the longer you last. The longer you last, the luckier you are. Rasputin moves a chesspiece and bellows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Checkmate!   Checkmate! He is ecstatic, bubbling with his joy.    Laughter springs from him. Jocko and PK trade a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an end to everything, boyo. Even luck. Jocko exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 213   EXT. HOSPITAL - DAY                                      213 PK walks to the seamy metal gate dressed, healed. Rasputin, his hands still bandaged, walks alongside of him. Rasputin is concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I guess this is goodbye, my friend. I'll never forget you. Rasputin speaks urgently in Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Botha.   Nyet, nyet.   Nyet, Botha. PK does not respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care, my friend. He grasps Rasputin's bandaged hand to shake it. Rasputin takes him around in a huge bear hug, smothering him. Pk survives, a bit rumpled. He smiles at Rasputin and exits. As he walks away,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   Botha.   Nyet. Nyet.    PK. PK turns the corner and is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 214   EXT. MINING TOWN                                               214 PK walks through the huts of the drillers, massive to a man. Most of them are coming off shift. Some of them rub their temples, trying to soothe the pain of the powder. PK comes to one hut.     He knocks.   No answer.   He knocks again. A DRILLER comes by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who you lookin' for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Botha. The driller from stope number five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't disturb him. There's a reason he's there and we're here. The Driller enters his hut.     PK absorbs the warning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 215   EXT. MINER'S BAR                                               215 The three BARTENDERS stand outside along with a dozen other customers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 199   PK                                                       199 141. making it back onto the bars. He carefully makes his way to Elijah as the hangup sends some pebbles down.

dialogue.raw_text: : 212   INT. HOSPITAL BED                                       212 145. Pk sits in the hospital bed, battered but otherwise in good shape. Rasputin sits in a wheelchair by his bed- side, his hands and chest bandaged, pondering the chess- board between them. Jocko enters.

direction.raw_text: .   You're not going to go in,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Botha the driller in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ja. Always we give him one hour alone before we open. You don't know this because you work at night, but it is the rule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ja.   In one hour it is pffft. He motions a man falling on his face. PK regards them for a moment and then enters the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 216   INT. BAR                                                  216 In the murky light one hulking figure sits at the bar, drinking shot after shot of whiskey. PK enters and walks across the room to the massive man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you Botha? Botha does not turn around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ja.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm PK.   I worked your grizzly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ja.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you try to kill me? Botha turns slowly to reveal his face, swollen with anger and drink. He tears the short sleeve off his left arm, revealing a crudely tattooed swastika.

direction.raw_text: Because I missed the first time, rooinek.

direction.raw_text: Because    of you they expelled me. Because    of you my father beat me. Threw me    out from the farm. Because    of you. He throws back another drink and rushes PK with a roar. PK sidesteps and heads for the door. Botha gets there first and bolts it.

direction.raw_text: Botha. We've made a lot of money working together. Let the past be the past.

direction.raw_text: You ruined the country, all you rooineks. You come and ruin the country. He rushes PK again.     Again PK sidesteps.

direction.raw_text: No, Jaapie Botha. It's hate ruining the country.

direction.raw_text: Our country. At that moment the powder headache strikes. Botha bellows, grabbing his head staggering backward. PK runs for the door. As he reaches it a table slams against it, thrown halfway across the room by a powder-mad Botha.

direction.raw_text: . PK jumps out of the way at the last minute. Men's faces begin to appear at the iron-meshed windows. People start to bang at the door. PK, realizing there is no talking to Botha now, does his best to stay out of the charging giant's way. Botha charges him. PK sidesteps and hits him with a left hook. The punch has no effect. Botha swings out wildly. PK easily dances away. Botha picks up another table and heaves it at PK. PK jumps to avoid it, but trips on an overturned stool. He goes down. The miners outside, crowding three deep, yell and shout. People start to make bets. Botha charges PK as PK scrambles up. Botha swings. The blow glances off PK's shoulder and sends him flying, spinning over a table. Botha leaps at PK, driving him into the wall. PK grimaces, sagging. Botha picks him up and starts to squeeze him to death in his massive arms. PK, his hands free, starts to pound on Botha's ears with his palms. Botha screams as the powder head- ache accelerates through the top of his skull. He drops PK. PK rolls away and swings a stool at Botha's midsection. Botha is driven back. PK goes to swing the stool again. Botha catches it as if it were made of balsa. He rips it out of PK's hand and flings it back at him, charging behind it. PK goes topping end over end. Botha gets a hand on him and lifts him from behind. He flings PK over the bar. PK hits the floor, stunned. Botha pulls at the bar trying to get at PK. He rocks the bar and rocks the bar as PK is trying to regain his bearings. Finally, with one tremendous rip, the bar comes away from its bolting. Botha pulls it aside. PK rises just as Botha moves in. PK hits him three solid shots to the stomach but Botha hardly feels them. He grabs PK and starts to squeeze him again. Face to face, Botha's crazed eyes watch the life fade from PK's. 217   CLOSEUP                                                       217 PK's eyes going blank. direction.raw_text: pounds into Botha's ribs under another wild swinging punch by the giant. Botha shouts and keeps advancing, swinging. PK backs up, peppering him, leading him forward. Left-right. He punishes Botha for each punch the big man throws, but always backing up. Botha, half blind, spitting blood follows. The crowd screams for him to move side to side.   The betting changes fast and furious. PK glances over his  shoulder to the cement wall behind him. He takes two   more steps and then fires two jabs at Botha's face and  then stands stock still. Wild with anger, Botha throws  a huge right hand to PK's head.

direction.raw_text: At the last moment PK sidesteps. Botha's hand    smashes into the cement wall. His hand shatters into    a hundred pieces. The pain is so immense he is rendered    helpless. PK doesn't waste a second. He starts banging    away at Botha with hard, fast combinations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to see the wages of hate? Botha feels the punches.   He steps back, faltering. PK pursues him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here.   Here is what hate gets you. PK hammers away, punching with each word, harder and faster.
